arts.ttl: Frank Lampard makes 'tougher' demand after watching Coventry City for the first time in the flesh
arts.sum: Asked for his assessment of his first game in charge, City’s new head coach said: “A mixture of feelings, I guess, some good and some less so in terms of the performance. We have had two days and it’s hard to make an impact with that but I saw some things that probably relate to why we are where we are, especially early in the second half when we conceded and our reaction took a while so I had to impact it with subs.

arts.ttl: Torp holds nerve on Lampard’s return to earn Coventry draw with Cardiff
arts.athr: Ben Fisher at the Coventry Building Society Arena
arts.sum: After the big, bold buildup that accompanied Frank Lampard’s arrival as Coventry’s head coach, awkwardly his first match in charge was in danger of falling flat. Coventry were floundering but a late handball against Calum Chambers offered the substitute Victor Torp the chance to establish parity from the penalty spot. With 88 minutes on the clock, Torp sent Jak Alnwick the wrong way, a sweet spot-kick. On the touchline Lampard, in a black trench coat, was unmoved. On Thursday, his first day in the job, LED screens around this stadium trumpeted Lampard’s entrance to the stage. Everything seemed geared up for him to make the perfect start as Coventry entertained Cardiff, a team still fumbling around without a permanent manager and an away win all season. Sixty-nine days on from Cardiff sacking Erol Bulut, Omer Riza continues to do an admirable job in interim charge. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Cardiff City player ratings at Coventry City as star has huge second half and youngster impresses on debut
arts.sum: Here is how the Bluebirds rated in the clash at the CBS Arena

arts.ttl: Coventry earn late point in Lampard's first game
arts.sum: Frank Lampard's first game as Coventry head coach ended in a 2-2 draw against fellow Championship strugglers Cardiff thanks to Victor Torp's late penalty.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as pen snatches draw from jaws of defeat for Frank Lampard - Andy Turner
arts.sum: City, however, got back on level terms just three minutes later when Tatsuhiro Sakamoto lifted the ball over the Bluebirds’ back line to feed Ephron Mason-Clark who timed his run to perfection and slid in to volley past the goalkeeper. However, Cardiff came out in determined mood in the second half and restored their lead three minutes into the restart when Alex Robertson received the ball some 25-30 yards out and hit a powerful shot that curled away from the keeper Collins who dived full stretch to his left but couldn’t keep the inch-perfect finish out.

Having ended the first half on the back foot, the Bluebirds showed their renewed intent immediately following the interval, beginning with another Meite strike seconds after the restart, this time held by ‘keeper Collins. The Sky Blues sought a repeat of the first half through an immediate equaliser, and Alnwick had to be alert in the minutes following as he turned a quickly taken free-kick around his near post.

arts.ttl: Coventry City 2-2 Cardiff City: Bluebirds' winless run extends to five as late Torp penalty cancels out Robertson stunner
arts.sum: The Bluebirds took on the Sky Blues in the CBS Arena and drew 2-2

arts.ttl: Coventry fight back to draw with Cardiff in Frank Lampard’s first game in charge
arts.sum: Victor Torp’s late penalty prevented Lampard starting his reign in the midlands with a damaging defeat.
